name: gobuster
tool_description:
Gobuster is a tool used to brute-force:
 - URIs (directories and files) in web sites.
 - DNS subdomains (with wildcard support).
 - Virtual Host names on target web servers.
 - Open Amazon S3 buckets
 - TFTP servers
args_description:
command: gobuster [mode] ...

Available Modes:
  completion  Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell.
  dir         Uses directory/file enumeration mode.
              Example: gobuster dir -u http://example.com -w wordlist.txt
  dns         Uses DNS subdomain enumeration mode.
              Example: gobuster dns -d example.com -w subdomains.txt
  fuzz        Uses fuzzing mode. Replaces the keyword FUZZ in the URL, Headers, and the request body.
              Example: gobuster fuzz -u http://example.com/FUZZ -w fuzzlist.txt
  s3          Uses AWS S3 bucket enumeration mode.
              Example: gobuster s3 -w bucketlist.txt
  tftp        Uses TFTP enumeration mode.
              Example: gobuster tftp -u tftp://example.com -w wordlist.txt
  version     Shows the current version of gobuster.
              Example: gobuster version
  vhost       Uses virtual host enumeration mode (you most probably want to use the IP address as the URL parameter).
              Example: gobuster vhost -u http://192.168.1.1 -w vhostlist.txt

When using gobuster with a wordlist remember to ALWAYS ask the path to the wordlist to the user.
